sentences.en: a member of an ancient noble family

sentences.cn: 人人称颂他的崇高品德.

sentences.en: He died for a noble cause.
sentences.cn: 他为了高尚的事业而牺牲。

sentences.en: He framed his life according to a noble pattern.
sentences.cn: 他以高尚的模式构筑自己生活的框架.

sentences.en: He had implicit faith in the noble intentions of the Emperor.
sentences.cn: 他对皇帝陛下高尚的动机深信不疑。

sentences.en: He is considered to be of noble origins.
sentences.cn: 人们都认为他出身高贵.

sentences.en: He was descended from a noble family.
His attempt to save the poor people's homes was truly noble.
sentences.cn: 他拯救穷人家园的尝试确实非常高尚.

sentences.en: His noble ideas and polite behavior are laudable.
sentences.cn: 他崇高的思想和彬彬有礼的举止令人赞美.

sentences.en: It was very noble of you to look after your old neighbour when she was sick.
sentences.cn: 你的心真好,你的老邻居生病时你一直照料她.

sentences.en: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.cn: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.en: Niagara falls is a noble sight.
sentences.cn: 尼亚加拉瀑布是一壮观的景色.

sentences.en: People adore him for his noble character.
sentences.cn: 人们因他的高贵品质而敬爱他.

sentences.en: The heroes set us a noble example.
sentences.cn: 英雄们给我们树立了崇高的榜样.

sentences.en: There are many good, nay noble qualities.
sentences.cn: 不但有许多美好的, 而且还有高尚的品质.

sentences.en: We'll always justify our actions with noble sounding theories.
sentences.cn: 我们总会用听起来非常高尚的理论为我们的行动辩护。

sentences.en: What a noble spirit this is!

words.tran_cn: 崇高地；高贵地；华丽地；豪爽地

trans.tran_cn: 高尚的，贵族的，外表庄严和庄重的，表现出崇高的
trans.tran_en: morally good or generous in a way that is admired

trans.tran_cn: 尊贵的人，旧时在英国使用的金币
trans.tran_en: a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’
